verses.verse: Elihu <WH453> also proceeded <WH3254>, and said <WH559>,
Suffer <WH3803> me a little <WH2191>, and I will show <WH2331> thee <WH4405>; For I have yet somewhat to say on God <WH433>'s behalf.
I will fetch <WH5375> my knowledge <WH1843> from afar <WH7350>, And will ascribe <WH5414> righteousness <WH6664> to my Maker <WH6466>.
For truly <WH551> my words <WH4405> are not false <WH8267>: One that is perfect <WH8549> in knowledge is with thee <WH1844>.
Behold <WH410>, God is mighty <WH3524>, and despiseth <WH3988> not any <WH3524>: He is mighty in strength <WH3581> of understanding <WH3820>.
He preserveth not the life <WH2421> of the wicked <WH7563>, But giveth <WH5414> to the afflicted <WH6041> their right <WH4941>.
He withdraweth <WH1639> not his eyes <WH5869> from the righteous <WH6662>: But with kings <WH4428> upon the throne <WH3678> He setteth <WH3427> them for ever <WH5331>, and they are exalted <WH1361>.
And if they be bound <WH631> in fetters <WH2131>, And be taken <WH3920> in the cords <WH2256> of afflictions <WH6040>;
Then he showeth <WH5046> them their work <WH6467>, And their transgressions <WH6588>, that they have behaved themselves proudly <WH1396>.
He openeth <WH1540> also their ear <WH241> to instruction <WH4148>, And commandeth <WH559> that they return <WH7725> from iniquity <WH205>.
If they hearken <WH8085> and serve <WH5647> him <WH3615>, They shall spend their days <WH3117> in prosperity <WH2896>, And their years <WH8141> in pleasures <WH5273>.
But if they hearken <WH8085> not <WH5674>, they shall perish by the sword <WH7973>, And they shall die <WH1478> without knowledge <WH1847>.
But they that are godless <WH2611> in heart <WH3820> lay up <WH7760> anger <WH639>: They cry <WH7768> not for help when he bindeth them <WH631>.
They <WH5315> die <WH4191> in youth <WH5290>, And their life <WH2416> perisheth among the unclean <WH6945>.
He delivereth <WH2502> the afflicted <WH6041> by their affliction <WH6040>, And openeth <WH1540> their ear <WH241> in oppression <WH3906>.

Yea <WH5496>, he would have allured thee out of distress <WH6310> Into a broad place <WH7338>, where <WH8478> there is no straitness <WH4164>; And that which is set <WH5183> on thy table <WH7979> would be full <WH4390> of fatness <WH1880>.
But thou art full <WH4390> of the judgment <WH1779> of the wicked <WH7563>: Judgment <WH1779> and justice <WH1779> take hold on thee <WH8551>.
For let not wrath <WH2534> stir thee up against <WH5496> chastisements <WH5607>; Neither let the greatness <WH7230> of the ransom <WH3724> turn thee aside <WH5186>.
Will thy cry <WH7769> avail <WH6186>, that thou be not in distress <WH1222>, Or all the forces <WH3981> of thy strength <WH3581>?
Desire <WH7602> not the night <WH3915>, When peoples <WH5971> are cut off in their place <WH5927>.
Take heed <WH8104>, regard <WH6437> not iniquity <WH205>: For this hast thou chosen <WH977> rather than affliction <WH6040>.
Behold <WH410>, God doeth loftily <WH7682> in his power <WH3581>: Who is a teacher like unto him <WH3384>?
Who hath enjoined <WH6485> him his way <WH1870>? Or who can say <WH559>, Thou hast wrought <WH6466> unrighteousness <WH5766>?
Remember <WH2142> that thou magnify <WH7679> his work <WH6467>, Whereof men <WH582> have sung <WH7891>.
All men <WH120> have looked <WH2372> thereon <WH582>; Man beholdeth <WH5027> it afar off <WH7350>.
Behold <WH410>, God is great <WH7689>, and we know <WH3045> him not <WH4557>; The number of his years <WH8141> is unsearchable <WH2714>.
For he draweth up <WH1639> the drops <WH5198> of water <WH4325>, Which distil <WH2212> in rain <WH4306> from his vapor <WH108>,
Which the skies <WH7834> pour down <WH7491> And drop <WH5140> upon man <WH120> abundantly <WH7227>.
Yea <WH995>, can any understand the spreadings <WH4666> of the clouds <WH5645>, The thunderings <WH8663> of his pavilion <WH5521>?
Behold <WH6566>, he spreadeth his light <WH216> around him <WH3680>; And he covereth the bottom <WH8328> of the sea <WH3220>.
For by these he judgeth <WH1777> the peoples <WH5971>; He giveth <WH5414> food <WH400> in abundance <WH4342>.
He covereth <WH3680> his hands <WH3709> with the lightning <WH216>, And giveth it a charge <WH6680> that it strike the mark <WH6293>.
The noise <WH7452> thereof telleth <WH5046> concerning him <WH4735>, The cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up <WH5927>.
